testCases.name: test_case_0
testCases.input: Who was the widow affected by the Same-sex marriage decision ruled on by the Sixth Circuit from Ohio?
context: The case was named after plaintiff Jim Obergefell, who sued the state of Ohio after officials refused to recognize his marriage on the death certificate of his husband.

On April 28, 2015, the Supreme Court of the United States heard oral arguments for "Obergefell v. Hodges" (Ohio), which was consolidated with three other same-sex marriage cases from the other states in the Sixth Circuit: "Tanco v. Haslam" (Tennessee), "DeBoer v. Snyder" (Michigan), "Bourke v. Beshear" (Kentucky).

inputParameters.query: Same-sex marriage in the Sixth Circuit

metricsData.name: Exact Match
metricsData.reason: The actual and expected outputs are exact matches.
